page.title: 05TAPELEY PARK
page.content: Tapeley Park was first opened to the public in 1977. The house is owned by Rosamund Christie and she has made it her lifes work to restore the house. Miss Christie is a great lover of nature and there are lots of animals there today, like chickens, geese, peacocks and rabbits. You can also sometimes catch a glimpse of her pet parrot called "Porgelot Pie".The house has many ornaments and furniture inside. Tapeley Park attracts hundreds of holiday makers each year. In one garden there is a large pool with fish and wild life in it. There has been a house on the site since Doomsday, when it was held by the Bishop of Exeter. The estate has about 6,000 acres, which include Braunton Burrowes and the beaches at Instow and Saunton.
